fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: Office Open XML (OOXML, ISO 29500, ECMA 376) Format Family
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:productionPhase: OOXML can be used in any production phase for office documents, which are certainly created (initial state), exchanged for editing and review (middle-state) and may be published (final-state).

fdd:relatedTo.fdd:titleName: Open Packaging Conventions (Office Open XML) , ISO/IEC 29500-2:2008-2012

fdd:relationship.fdd:comment: Application-specific formats in the OOXML family and the OPC packaging format. See OPC/OOXML_2012. These include .docx, .pptx, and .xlsx files as produced by Microsoft Office products since Office 2007, not described at this web site at this time.

fdd:relatedTo.fdd:titleName: Markup Compatibility and Extensibility (Office Open XML), ISO 29500-3:2008-2012

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:disclosure: Family of formats based on international open standard. Maintained by ISO/IEC JTC1 SC34/WG4. Originated by Microsoft Corporation and first standardized through ECMA International in 2006. Approval as ISO/IEC 29500 was in 2008.

fdd:documentation.p: ISO/IEC 29500, Information technology -- Document description and processing languages -- Office Open XML File Formats -- Parts 1-4. Latest version (2012 as of July 2014) is available from ISO/IEC Publicly Available Standards.
All editions of the OOXML standards as published by ECMA are available from ECMA-376: Office Open XML File Formats. See Notes below for a chronology.

fdd:licensingAndPatents.p: The specification originated from Microsoft Corporation. MCE/OOXML_2012 and future versions of ISO/IEC 29500-3 and ECMA-376 are covered by Microsoft's Open Specification Promise, whereby Microsoft "irrevocably promises" not to assert any claims against those making, using, and selling implementations of any specification covered by the promise (so long as those accepting the promise refrain from suing Microsoft for patent infringement in relation to Microsoft's implementation of the covered specification).

fdd:filenameExtension.fdd:note: And extensions used by other formats based on the OOXML specifications.

fdd:history.p: The original OOXML specification was published as ECMA-376 in 2006, there has been no change in the MCE format. The chronology of editions specifying OOXML is:

A new edition of Part 3 of the specification, for Markup Compatibility and Extensibility, has been prepared and a Draft International Standard ballot started in June 2014. The intent is to clarify the explanation and to emphasize the applicability of MCE beyond OOXML to support interoperability. This edition does not introduce any new features but does remove some flexibility that had not been exploited in practice and is deemed unnecessary. Most important, makes the process for handling MCE on file import much clearer.

fdd:urlGroup.fdd:intro: The latest version of each part of ISO/IEC 29500 is made available at no charge from ISO. The formal title is Information technology -- Document description and processing languages -- Office Open XML File Formats

fdd:urlReference.tag: ECMA-376: Office Open XML File Formats
fdd:urlReference.comment: Provides access to all chronological published versions.
